description: A luxurious and deeply comforting stew where tender chicken pieces are simmered in a thick, creamy, and richly flavored sauce made from groundnut paste. The nutty, savory sauce perfectly complements the chicken, creating a hearty and satisfying dish that is a favorite for family meals and special occasions alike.

cultural_significance.cultural_notes: Chicken in groundnut sauce is considered a 'special' meal in many Ugandan households. It is a dish prepared to show care and hospitality, often for visiting relatives or during celebrations. The richness of the groundnuts elevates the chicken, making it feel festive. It is a common dish for Sunday family lunches, bringing everyone together around a pot of this flavorful, communal stew.

ingredients.name: Chicken, cut into pieces
ingredients.notes: About 1.5kg, can use a mix of thighs, drumsticks, and breasts

steps.instruction: Heat the cooking oil in a heavy-bottomed pot over medium-high heat. Add the chicken pieces and brown them on all sides for about 5-7 minutes. You may need to do this in batches. Remove the chicken and set aside.
In the same pot, reduce the heat to medium. Add the chopped onion and saut√© until soft and translucent, about 3-4 minutes.
Add the minced garlic and grated ginger. Stir for 1 minute until fragrant.
Add the tomato paste and stir for 1 minute to cook out its raw flavor.
Add the chopped tomatoes, salt, and chicken seasoning. Cook for 5-7 minutes, stirring occasionally, until the tomatoes have broken down and formed a thick sauce.

Return the browned chicken pieces to the pot along with any accumulated juices. Add 2 cups of water. Bring to a boil, then reduce the heat to low, cover, and simmer for 20-25 minutes, or until the chicken is cooked through and tender.
While the chicken is simmering, in a separate bowl, gradually whisk the groundnut paste with the remaining 2 cups of water until you have a very smooth, lump-free, creamy liquid.
Once the chicken is tender, pour the smooth groundnut mixture into the pot. Stir gently to combine with the tomato base and chicken.

Bring the stew back to a gentle simmer. Cook uncovered for 10-15 minutes, stirring frequently to prevent the groundnuts from sticking to the bottom, until the sauce has thickened to a rich, creamy gravy consistency.

cooking_indicators.visual: The sauce will be thick, creamy, and coat the back of a spoon. Oil may shimmer on the surface.

steps.instruction: Taste and adjust salt if needed. If the sauce is too thick, add a little hot water. Serve hot.

serving_suggestions: Serve this rich stew with a staple carbohydrate to soak up the delicious sauce. It is perfect with Posho (Ugali), White Rice, or Matoke. A side of steamed greens like Sukuma Wiki or Dodo provides a fresh contrast.
